item.woh.shotogatana.tooltip:
A precise blade paired with a siya. 
 nimble and capable of cutting through the toughest of armor with style
item.woh.tessen.tooltip:
A nimble war fan that strikes with quick precision. 
 this mighty weapon is able to be thrown 
when paired with another in the offhand, allowing for ranged attacks
item.woh.tsume.tooltip: A pair of sharp claws designed with close range swiping attacks in mind.
item.woh.arbiters_blade.tooltip: A Mysterious And Ancient Blade That Seems to Hold Some Sort Of Hidden Power.. Or even. Courage?
item.woh.arbiters_shield.tooltip: An Extremely Durable Metal Shield, the metal used in the shield seems unworldly?
item.woh.wakizashi.tooltip: A short and nimble, one sided blade that is capable of being dual wielded
item.woh.odachi.tooltip: A large, one sided greatsword that is slow but powerful
item.woh.folded_iron.tooltip:
A piece of iron that with much higher density than regular iron. 
Although tough, it tends to be fragile without being smelted first
item.woh.folded_steel.tooltip: A very dense piece of steel
item.woh.hardened_steel_ingot.tooltip:
An extremely durable and hard metal 
that can be used to craft weapons of great variety
skill.woh.shotogatana_skill.tooltip:
Once the cooldown is charged, you can execute a different combo 
depending on the current attack animation.
skill.woh.shotogatana_skill.tooltip.extr: If no attack animation is present, you will perform a sheathed slash too quick for the human eye to see...
skill.woh.throw_stance.tooltip:
You cannot guard with this weapon, however instead 
you are able to aim and use ranged attacks via holding guard and attacking...
skill.woh.enraged_claws.tooltip:
Once the cooldown is charged, you can enter a stance in which allows you to have a completely new moveset. 
This moveset allows you to attack in rapid succession, pummeling any enemies in your way!
skill.woh.arbiters_slash.tooltip:
Once the weapon is fully charged, the blade will enter a state, 
allowing the user to cast magic sharp spinning wheel cutters..
